title: Single Responsibility Principle
description: Each microservice should have a single, well-defined responsibility
details: Design each microservice around a specific business capability or domain. Avoid creating god services that handle multiple unrelated concerns.

title: API Gateway Pattern
description: Use an API Gateway as a single entry point for all client requests
details: Implement an API Gateway to handle cross-cutting concerns like authentication, rate limiting, and request routing.

title: Service-to-Service Authentication
details: Use JWT tokens, mTLS, or service mesh for secure service-to-service communication. Never trust internal network traffic implicitly.

title: Container-Based Deployment
description: Deploy microservices as containers for consistency and portability
details: Use Docker or similar container technology. Ensure each service has its own container with all dependencies bundled.

title: Contract Testing
description: Implement contract tests between service consumers and providers
details: Use tools like Pact or Spring Cloud Contract to ensure API compatibility between services.

title: Independent Deployment
description: Each microfrontend should be independently deployable
details: Design microfrontends so they can be developed, tested, and deployed independently without affecting other microfrontends.

title: Framework Agnostic
description: Microfrontends should be framework agnostic where possible
details: Use module federation, web components, or iframes to enable different frameworks to coexist.

title: Shared Security Context
description: Implement a shared security context across microfrontends
details: Use a central authentication service and share security tokens across microfrontends securely.

title: CDN Distribution
description: Deploy microfrontends to CDN for optimal performance
details: Use CDN services to distribute static assets globally. Implement cache invalidation strategies.

title: Integration Testing
details: Ensure proper testing of shell application integration, routing, and state sharing between microfrontends.
